intro: Moraea marionae, commonly known as Marion's moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and careful watering to thrive.
